intro: Calochortus uniflorus, commonly known as the single-flower mariposa lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus in the family Liliaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and a single, showy flower that typically blooms in late spring or early summer. Its petals are often a striking combination of white, yellow, and orange, making it a visually appealing wildflower. Calochortus uniflorus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open meadows and rocky areas.
